metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1226 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The DebuggerFunction::InitAgentHost function in browser/extensions/api/debugger/debugger_api.cc in Google Chrome before 41.0.2272.76 does not properly restrict what URLs are available as debugger targets, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via a crafted extension.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-browser-l10n - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-chromedriver - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> This bug is in Chrome/Chromium

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0.2272.76-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1076').
